description: Returns the most closely associated package group to the specified package. This API does not require that the package exist in any repository in the domain. As such, GetAssociatedPackageGroup can be used to see which package group's origin configuration applies to a package before that package is in a repository. This can be helpful to check if public packages are blocked without ingesting them. For information package group association and matching, see Package group definition syntax and matching behavior in the CodeArtifact User Guide.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain that contains the package from which to get the associated package group.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the package from which to get the associated package group.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the package from which to get the associated package group. The package component that specifies its namespace depends on its type. For example: The namespace of a Maven package version is its groupId. The namespace of an npm or Swift package version is its scope. The namespace of a generic package is its namespace. Python, NuGet, Ruby, and Cargo package versions do not contain a corresponding component, package versions of those formats do not have a namespace.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: The package from which to get the associated package group.

nested_items.name: packageGroup
nested_items.description: The package group that is associated with the requested package.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the package group.

nested_items.name: pattern
nested_items.description: The pattern of the package group. The pattern determines which packages are associated with the package group.

nested_items.name: domainName
nested_items.description: The name of the domain that contains the package group.

nested_items.name: domainOwner
nested_items.description: The 12-digit account number of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the domain. It does not include dashes or spaces.

nested_items.name: createdTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that represents the date and time the package group was created.

nested_items.name: contactInfo
nested_items.description: The contact information of the package group.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the package group.

nested_items.name: originConfiguration
nested_items.description: The package group origin configuration that determines how package versions can enter repositories.

nested_items.name: restrictions
nested_items.description: The origin configuration settings that determine how package versions can enter repositories.

nested_items.name: mode
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: mode
nested_items.description: The package group origin restriction setting. If the value of mode is ALLOW, ALLOW_SPECIFIC_REPOSITORIES, or BLOCK, then the value of effectiveMode is the same. Otherwise, when the value is INHERIT, then the value of effectiveMode is the value of mode of the first parent group which does not have a value of INHERIT.

nested_items.name: effectiveMode
nested_items.description: The effective package group origin restriction setting. If the value of mode is ALLOW, ALLOW_SPECIFIC_REPOSITORIES, or BLOCK, then the value of effectiveMode is the same. Otherwise, when the value of mode is INHERIT, then the value of effectiveMode is the value of mode of the first parent group which does not have a value of INHERIT.

nested_items.name: inheritedFrom
nested_items.description: The parent package group that the package group origin restrictions are inherited from.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the package group.

nested_items.name: pattern
nested_items.description: The pattern of the package group. The pattern determines which packages are associated with the package group, and is also the identifier of the package group.

nested_items.name: repositoriesCount
nested_items.description: The number of repositories in the allowed repository list.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the package group.

nested_items.name: pattern
nested_items.description: The pattern of the package group. The pattern determines which packages are associated with the package group, and is also the identifier of the package group.

nested_items.name: associationType
nested_items.description: Describes the strength of the association between the package and package group. A strong match is also known as an exact match, and a weak match is known as a relative match.
